intro: Sauropus brunonis, commonly known as the broadleaf hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that can grow up to 30 centimeters in length. The plant produces showy yellow flowers with prominent stamens, which are typical of the Malvaceae family. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for horticultural use in gardens and landscapes.
